acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred from JMU's Facilities Management Engineering Department in 2006.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The Harrisonburg High School drawings became property of James Madison University after the university purchased the high school in 2006.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Due to the artificial nature of this collection, a historical note is not applicable. Refer to the bibliography for further historical information pertaining to specific campus buildings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The JMU Architectural Drawings Collection, 1914-1983, is comprised of one oversize box and two oversize folders (7 linear feet) of blue prints, pencil tracings, and linen drawings of various JMU buildings, their corresponding mechanical systems, and campus grounds. The collection contains architectural plans of Alumnae Hall, Miller Hall, Harrisonburg High School (Memorial Hall), the Students' Building (Harrison Hall), the Practice House (Varner House), and the Home Economics Building (Moody Hall) and topographic drawings of the university's campus. The plans were created on four different surfaces, including pencil on linen, ink on linen, pencil on tracing paper, and carbon copy paper.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged according to media type (i.e. carbon copy, linen, and tracing paper), the description of the drawings, and their size.
